result.execSummary:
Micky Ly was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Micky Ly was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micky Ly

records.addlTxt: 8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Micky Ly not in court.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson in court for Micky Ly.  Defendant waived extradition and has been picked up.  Court grants state's motion to dismiss.
Review hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Micky Ly appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson in court for Micky Ly. Defendant waives extradition; Court accepts waiver. Defendant signs waiver; Court will sign when received. Court orders bond revoked.
Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Extradition hearing on July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Micky Ly appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan O'Hara appeared by video on behalf of Colin T Nicholson for Micky Ly. Matter to be set for decision on Extradition Hearing.
records.courtRptr: D Nelson / J Klaren / M Lindbloom

Mason C Braunschweig and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued to speak to Attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 3:00 PM.

11:34 AM Defendant Micky Ly in court, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. Defendant to contact State Public Defender.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Extradition hearing on June 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:54 PM Defendant Micky Ly in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Colin T Nicholson also appearing by video. Noah Tylenda  appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $10,000.00   with conditions.  Remand to Judge Kuglitsch for scheduling.
